data.title: Digital Fortress by Dan Brown, First Edition, Signed
data.meta_description: DIGITAL FORTRESS by Brown, Dan and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First revised edition, first printing. "Revised edition May 2004" statement and first printing number code sequence 10 through 1 to the copyright page. SIGNED by the author of THE DA VINCI CODE to a decoratively bordered bookplate that is loosely laid in. A techno-thriller featuring National Security Agent head cryptographer Susan Fletcher, that deals with computer hackers, breeches, past atomic bomb results, and future bomb threats. Barely perceptible crimp to the lower front corner tip, else very nearly fine and firm in blue linen-boards with silver embossed titles to the spine, blue-and-white headband and tail-band; in a fine dust jacket with front cover photo-art by Paul Robertson; original printed $19.95 price still intact to the front inner flap. NO remainder mark commonly found on this revised edition. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Brown, Dan., St. Martin's Press, 1998, c1998, 1st Edition, 4th printing, boards (hard cover), very minor dampstain slightly affecting part of the bottom edge of text block (not throughout; see photo) o/w very good with very good+ dj, 371 pp, 8vo, ISBN: 031218087X, Nicely inscribed & SIGNED by the author: 'Mike - My friend Chuck thought you might enjoy this. Hoping So! Dan Brown', 'A lightning-paced thriller that U.S. intelligence analysts are calling 'utterly plausible'., Signed copies of Brown's first book are becoming scarce. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: As New. 1st Edition. First edition. First printing. Hardbound. Fine/Fine. A tight clean copy of the author's first book, appears new and unread. SIGNED BY AUTHOR in full on title page and inscribed warmly to prior owner above his signature. This is an outstanding copy of a scarce book. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: As New. Steve Snider - cover design (illustrator). 1st Edition. First edition/printing. Book and jacket (in a protector and not price clipped) each in As New, unread condition! Bought new and stored immediately. Signed by Brown on the title page without inscription and not on a laid in book plate! First novel by Brown who would later become famous, of course, for his novel The Da Vinci Code. A stunning example. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: As New. First Edition. 1998. Hardcover. Fine/Fine. First Edition, First Printing of the author's First Book. A very fine copy with a nice early signature by the author directly on the title page. This copy in unread and the DJ has been protected in an archival covering. Very nice. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: As New. 1st Edition. First edition. First printing. Hardbound. Full number line down to the 1. Signed by author on title page (name only, without any further writing). A tight unread copy. With acid-free mylar dust jacket protector, very fine/very fine in all respects. Smoke-free. Defect-free. Shipped in well-padded sturdy boxes. The first printing of his first book. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: As New. First Edition. 1998. Hardcover. Fine/Fine. First Edition, First Printing of the author's First Book. Signed and warmly inscribed by the author. This copy is unread and the DJ has been protected in an archival covering. An excellent copy with a nice early signature. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine+. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition; First Printing. A most stunning true first edition/first printing in Very Fine condition in Fine dust jacket (the dust jacket has a barely visible chip on the bottom right front corner area) , SIGNED by author Dan Brown directly on the title page; Before the bestseller The Da Vinci Code, Dan Brown focused this novel on the most powerful intelligence organization on earth--the National Security Agency, an ultra-secret, multibillion-dollar agency many times more powerful than the CIA; 8vo; Signed by Author.
